alert.note: Alert for Parke; Vermillion; Vigo (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 10:09PM EST until February 02 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Illinois... Wabash River from Lafayette to Riverton. .Lowland flooding has developed along the Wabash River. Minor flooding could be made worse by any ice jams that develop as river ice breaks up with the warmer temperatures and moves downstream. This ice jam threat should come to an end over the weekend, but minor river flooding along the Wabash is expected to continue well into next week, aided by additional rainfall expected during the weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO FRIDAY, FEBRUARY 02... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Clinton. * WHEN...From this evening to Friday, February 02. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Lowland flooding in progress. River water runs through the City of Clinton`s wastewater treatment plant. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.0 feet early Monday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Saturday afternoon by around noon EST /1100 AM CST/.
